title: Thrifty chef Liam Boland reveals meal prepping secrets
text: 2 tbsp Chinese five spice Total: £3.40 (if you don't have them in the cupboard and need to purchase) Grand total: £29.80 To get started, clear a good sized work space as you will prepare all the food bags together. 'Prepare the vegetables as described in the shopping list and place in bowls at the top of the table or counter, the same with the herbs and spices,' Liam explained. 'Leave the meat to one side and the freezer bags to your left or right depending on if you are left or right handed. This makes working and filling the bags much quicker and easier for you. 'Open all the tins and have them ready.' SAUSAGE PASTA Brown the sausages on a pan then remove and allow to cool, you don't have to cook them fully just colour them. Place in a bag with one sliced pepper, one sliced onion, a handful of chopped basil leaves (if using them), one vegetable stock cube, two chopped garlic cloves and a tin of chopped tomatoes then seal the bag and set to one side. Slow cooker: High 90 minutes or hours or low three hours. Oven: 180C Gas mark 4, 90 minutes in a covered dish. Serve: With pasta or a big dollop of mashed potato. Sausages with peppers can be served with pasta or mashed potato BEEF STEW Place one pack of beef in a freezer bag, add the sliced mushrooms, one sliced onion, fresh thyme, the sliced carrots and celery, one beef stock cube, one tbsp paprika (regular), one tin chopped tomatoes and 150ml water. Slow cooker: High four hours or low six to eight hours. Oven: In covered dish 180C/Gas mark for two to three hours in covered dish. Pressure cooker: Pressure 80 for 45 minutes. Beef stew can be easily prepped in advance by adding all the ingredients to a freezer bag and then popping it in the slow cooker when you're ready PORK RIBS Place the ribs in a bowl then add 150g brown sugar, one tbsp ketchup, one tbsp Worcestershire sauce, three tbsp white vinegar, one tbsp each of cayenne pepper, one tbsp cumin, one tbsp garlic powder and one tbsp coarse ground black pepper and one tsp of salt. Mix really well then place in a freezer bag add one sliced pepper, one sliced onion, one vegetable stock cube and one tin of chopped tomatoes. Seal and set to one side. Slow cooker: High two to three hours or low five to six hours. Oven: 180C/Gas mark 4 for two to three hours in covered dish. Pressure cooker: Pressure 60 for 45 minutes. Adding plenty of spices and seasoning is the key to making these Chinese-style pork ribs delicious BACON STEW Place the washed and sliced cabbage in a bag then place one sliced onion on top followed by the bacon and one vegetable stock cube. Seal and set to one side. Add 1 tin chopped tomatoes and 200ml water before cooking. Slow cooker: High three hours or low five to six hours. Hob: In a covered pot bring to the boil and simmer for two hours. Pressure cooker: Pressure 60 for 30 to 40 minutes. To serve: Add four peeled and cubed potatoes for the last 45 minutes. This bacon stew can be whipped up in minutes by adding sliced cabbage, onion and bacon and some stock to a freezer bag BEEF CURRY Place the last pack of beef in a freezer bag then add, one sliced onion, two chopped garlic cloves, the cubed sweet potato, one sliced pepper, and either six tbsp of medium curry powder or two tbsp curry powder and one tbsp Garam masala, two tsp turmeric, one tbsp cumin and one tsp ground ginger. Then add the beef stock cube and tin of chopped tomatoes with a handful of chopped coriander if using it. Seal the bag and set to one side. Slow cooker: High four hours or low six to eight hours. Oven: Cook in covered dish 180C'Gas mark for two to three hours until meat is tender. PRESSURE COOKER – pressure 60 for 45 minutes. Serve with boiled rice. Everyone will be delighted with a delicious beef curry as a midweek treat CAJUN CHICKEN Place the chicken pieces in a freezer bag then add the cajun seasoning, one sliced pepper, one sliced onion and two chopped garlic cloves, one vegetable stock cube along with the coconut milk, seal and set to one side. Slow cooker: High for three hours or low for six to eight hours. Oven: Cook in a covered dish 180C GM4 for two to three hours until the chicken is tender and moist. Pressure cooker: Pressure 80 for 45 minutes. Serve with potato wedges or boiled rice. Everyone will be delighted to come home to Cajun chicken for dinner CHINESE PORK BELLY Place the pork belly slices in a bowl then add two tbsp of Chinese five spice or two tbsp of Thai 7 spice, one sliced onion, four sliced spring onions (optional), one sliced pepper, three tbsp spy sauce, five garlic cloves chopped, 50 ml of water and one tsp ground ginger. Mix really well then place everything in a freezer bag and seal. Slow cooker: High two hours or low four to five hours. Oven: Cook in a covered dish 180C for 90 minutes to two hours until the pork is tender. Pressure cooker: Pressure 60 for one hour. Chinese pork belly sounds like a complicated dish, but it's just a matter of adding some spices to the meat in a freezer bag
